intro: Linaria almijarensis, commonly known as the Almijar wild snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Linaria almijarensis is often found in coastal and inland areas, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
